I cannot say what is possible or not. but there are a few ways you can potentially avoid these issues:

1. use boot camp: boot camp is software that comes pre-installed on macs and allows you to install windows alongside macos. this allows you to run windows natively on your mac, without having to use virtualization software. this can improve compatibility and performance for pc games on macs.

2. use wine or crossover: wine and crossover are software that allow you to run windows applications on macos without needing to install windows. these can be used to run pc games on macs, and they can sometimes improve compatibility and performance.

3. use a cloud gaming service: there are several cloud gaming services that allow you to play pc games on a mac without needing to install any software. these services require a high-speed internet connection and can sometimes experience input lag or other issues, but they can provide a seamless experience for playing pc games on a mac.

4. virtualize windows correctly: ensure that your virtualization software is correctly set up to support the specific pc game you want to play. this may require tweaking settings such as graphics performance or virtual machine resources to ensure that the game runs smoothly.
